title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
China's services sector suffered an unexpectedly severe blow in August as a wave of Covid-19 infections spurred new lockdowns, sending an official gauge of nonmanufacturing activity into contractionary territory.

---

Zoom Video's quarterly revenue surpassed $1 billion for the first time, though the strong demand for its videoconferencing services is showing signs of easing.

---

Energy companies were assessing the health of refineries, pipelines, petrochemical plants and offshore oil platforms along the central Gulf of Mexico in Hurricane Ida's wake.

---

Dozens of United Airlines jets like the one that lost an engine cover over Colorado in February aren't expected to fly until early next year, as the FAA weighs additional safeguards.

---

Disney and its ABC unit held unsuccessful mediation talks in June with the two women who alleged they were sexually assaulted by former "GMA" producer Michael Corn.

---

The S&P 500 and Nasdaq gained 0.4% and 0.9%, respectively, to close at records, while the Dow industrials slipped 0.2%.

---

Robinhood's shares ended 6.9% lower after the SEC's Gensler signaled that he was open to banning the practice of payment for order flow.

---

China's Meituan posted another big jump in revenue, but the food-delivery giant remained unprofitable for a third straight quarter.
